context.p: If a drawing contains a lot of text using complex fonts, only a rectangular frame defining the text is displayed or plotted when you turn on Quick Text mode.

Text entities require a considerable amount of time to display and print. You can reduce the time it takes to display or print a drawing by enabling Quick Text. For example, if you're doing a preliminary check print of a drawing, you may want to turn Quick Text on to speed up printing. When Quick Text is enabled, text entities are replaced by rectangular boxes that indicate the outline of the area occupied by the text.
When you turn Quick Text on or off, you must regenerate the drawing before the change is displayed.
To turn Quick Text on and off

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Options from the mainmenu.
Under Display Performance, select or clear the Show Text Boundary Frame Only check box.

result.p: To regenerate your drawing, do one of the following:

ol.li: Choose View > Regen from the main menu.
Type REGEN on the command line andthen press Enter.
